commitResults.messageTitle: Use a class to represent tasks
Implement mark and unmark task methods
Add support for tracking ToDos, Events, Deadlines
commitResults.messageBody:
As there are multiple types of tasks that have some similarity between
them. Todo, Deadline and Event classes can inherit from Task class.

Todo, Deadline and Event classes have some common behaviors
(e.g. mark() unmark() toString()).

Extracting the common behavior into a super class Task allows us to use
polymorphism when dealing with Task attributes.

An automated test case can be run programmatically and the result of the
test case (pass or fail) is determined programmatically. Compared to
manual testing, automated testing reduces the effort required to run
tests repeatedly and increases precision of testing

Store the test input in the text file input.txt

Store the output you expect in another text file EXPECTED.TXT

Store the script to run the test in runtest.sh/runtest.bat

Refer to this tutorial for Test using the I/O redirection technique
https://se-education.org/guides/tutorials/textUiTesting.html

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement MeepException and handle possible errors
commitResults.messageBody:
Exceptions provide the means to separate the details of what to do when
something out of the ordinary happens from the main logic of a program.

MeepException handles invalid command, invalid date/time format and
invalid task number.

commitResults.messageTitle: Use Enumerations to represent the user command
Implement save and restore task from text file
Implement dates/time parsing and list by date
commitResults.messageBody:
Store deadline/event dates as a java.time.LocalDate in the task objects.
Accept dates in a format dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm format (e.g., 2/12/2019 18:00)
and print in a different format MMM d yyyy hh:mm a e.g., (Oct 15 2019 06:00 PM).

Also add new command for list. User can list task before specific date.
For example "list 09/12/2019 18:00", It will list deadline/event before this date.

Refactor the code to extract out closely related code as classes.
1. Extract Ui class to deal with interactions with the user
2. Extract Commnad class to  deal with user command
3. Extract Storage class to deal with data file restore and save
4. Extract Parser class to  deal with parsing user input
5. Extract TaskList class to  deal with actions on tasklist like add/delete

Use packages to avoid name conflicts, and to write a better maintainable code.

1.Group all Command classes under package commands.
2.Group all task classes under package task.
3.Put invalidInputException class under package exception.
4.Put Storage class under package storage.
5.Put Parder class under package parser.
6.Put Ui and Messages classes under package ui.

Extracting the parseUserInput() into different functions. For example,
checkTaskFormat() to check the task description format.

Add JUnit tests to test the behavior of the code.
1. test all commands class execute function
2. test Parser class with different input
3. test Storage class with vliad and invalid file path
4. test ListTask class with add/delete/generate mehtods

Placing Human Readable Descriptions inside of program detailing what
the Code is doing. Proper use of commenting can make code maintenance
much easier, as well as helping make finding bugs faster. Further,
commenting is very important when writing functions that other people
will use.

commitResults.messageTitle: Tweak the code to comply with Java coding standard
commitResults.messageBody:
The aim of a coding standard is to make the entire code
base look like it was written by one person.

Coding standards help in the development of software programs
that are less complex and thereby reduce the errors.

Give users a way to find a task by searching for a keyword.

Add another command class - FindCommand.
Add findTasks() method to ListTask Class.
Change Parser Class to parse find command.
Separates the main function into different parts

commitResults.messageTitle: Set up gradle for build, run and unit tests
Use checkStyle to detect coding style violations
